required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Research Study, Looking at How Tresiba® Works in People With Type 2 Diabetes in Local Clinical Practice in Russia
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Non-interventional Study Investigating the Treatment Effect of Tresiba® in Adult Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Russia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to collect information on how Tresiba® works in real world patients with Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 (type 2 diabetes). Participants will get Tresiba® as prescribed by their doctor. The study will last for around 6 to 8 months. Participants will be asked questions about their health and their diabetes treatment as part of their normal doctor's appointment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in laboratory measured glycated haemoglobin (HbA1c) (% point)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week -12 to 0) to end of study (week 26-36)
From baseline (week -12 to 0) to end of study (week 26-36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in laboratory measured fasting plasma glucose (FPG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week -12 to 0) to end of study (week 26-36)
From baseline (week -12 to 0) to end of study (week 26-36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in daily insulin doses (basal insulin)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week -12 to 0) to end of study (week 26-36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in daily insulin doses (prandial insulin)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week -12 to 0) to end of study (week 26-36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in daily insulin doses (total insulin)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week -12 to 0) to end of study (week 26-36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in number of patient reported overall non-severe hypoglycaemic episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre and Post- initiation of treatment with Tresiba®. Episodes occurring within 4 weeks prior to initiation of treatment with Tresiba® (week -12 to 0) and within 4 weeks prior to end of study (week 26 to 36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in number of patient reported nocturnal non-severe hypoglycaemic episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre and Post- initiation of treatment with Tresiba®. Episodes occurring within 4 weeks prior to initiation of treatment with Tresiba® (week -12 to 0) and within 4 weeks prior to end of study (week 26 to 36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in number of patient reported severe hypoglycaemic episodes (overall)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre and Post- initiation of treatment with Tresiba®. Episodes occurring within 4 weeks prior to initiation of treatment with Tresiba® (week -12 to 0) and within 4 weeks prior to end of study (week 26 to 36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Reason(s) for discontinuing treatment with Tresiba® during the treatment period, if applicable (according to pre-specified response options)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After initiation of treatment with Tresiba® (week 0) until treatment discontinuation (week 26-36)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants per response option

intervention.description: Treatment with Tresiba® with or without anti-diabetes medication (as per local label), as prescribed by the participant's physician. The study population will include adult patients with type 2 diabetes, both insulin naïve and previously insulin treated, for whom the treating physician has decided to initiate treatment with Tresiba®, independent of the decision to include the patient in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed consent obtained before any study-related activities (study-related activities are any procedure related to recording of data according to the protocol).
- The decision to initiate treatment with commercially available Tresiba® has been made by the patient and the treating physician before and independently from the decision to include the patient in this study.
- Male or female, age above or equal to 18 years at the time of signing informed consent.
- Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes and treated with any antihyperglycemic medication(s), except Tresiba® (insulin degludec), for at least 26 weeks prior to Informed consent and Initiation Visit (Visit 1).
- Available and documented HbA1c value 12 weeks or less prior to initiation of Tresiba® treatment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous participation in this study. Participation is defined as having given informed consent in this study
- Mental incapacity, unwillingness or language barriers precluding adequate understanding or cooperation
- Hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients as specified in the Tresiba® local label

patient_data.ipd_description: According to the Novo Nordisk disclosure commitment on novonordisk-trials.com
